decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing the commander, Animar, Soul of Elements, to cast creatures with reduced mana costs and eventually combo off to generate powerful board states. The deck includes a variety of creatures with enter the battlefield abilities, as well as ways to search for specific creatures and ramp mana. The goal is to quickly build up Animar's counters and efficiently cast large creatures, such as Eldrazi titans, to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes ways to protect Animar and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to leverage Animar's abilities to create an explosive combo-centric strategy with a focus on casting big creatures efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Sidisi, Undead Vizier's ability to search for combo pieces and control elements to assemble game-winning combinations. By utilizing various tutor effects and graveyard manipulation spells, the deck aims to reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and then use cards like Phyrexian Devourer and Triskelion to generate a lethal combo. The deck also includes disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand, as well as removal spells like Damnation and Go for the Throat to deal with threats. Overall, the deck focuses on efficient combos and resource management to achieve victory in a competitive 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

The main strategy of this deck is to assemble combo pieces like Necrotic Ooze, Phyrexian Devourer, and Triskelion to create a game-winning combo. The deck includes a variety of tutors, card draw, and graveyard recursion to help find and play these combo pieces efficiently. Additionally, the deck includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Duress to control the opponent's hand and prevent them from interfering with the combo. The mana base is designed to provide consistent black mana sources with lands like Cabal Coffers and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a single explosive turn.

Thrun, the Last Troll is a powerful commander for an aggro deck focused on generating mana quickly and efficiently to overwhelm opponents with large creatures and powerful spells. The deck includes a variety of mana dorks such as Llanowar Elves and Birds of Paradise to accelerate mana production, along with powerful cards like Primeval Titan and Eternal Witness for value and recursion. It also includes removal spells like Beast Within and Path to Exile to deal with threats, as well as equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine to boost creature power. The deck aims to establish a solid mana base, ramp quickly, and use its creatures and spells to pressure opponents and secure victory.

This deck is focused on aggressive play with Anafenza, the Foremost as the commander. The deck includes a variety of creatures with powerful abilities to quickly put pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruption spells like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Council's Judgment to control the game. The deck also has a strong removal package with cards like Swords to Plowshares, Abrupt Decay, and Vindicate. Additionally, it includes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to enhance the commander's abilities. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of dual lands and mana dorks to ensure a consistent flow of mana.

The main concept of this deck is to build a strong aggro strategy using the commander Jenara, Asura of War, along with a variety of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. The deck aims to establish a quickly developing board presence with mana acceleration from creatures like Birds of Paradise and Llanowar Elves, while controlling the opponent's resources with counterspells and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice enhances the aggression of the deck by providing additional threats and combat tricks. By combining aggressive creatures with disruption and powerful equipment, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and decisively in one-on-one matches.

This deck focuses on utilizing Marath, Will of the Wild as a versatile and powerful commander to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. The key strategy involves ramping up mana with various mana dorks and lands like Gaea's Cradle, while using cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith to fetch essential creatures like Primeval Titan and Craterhoof Behemoth to close out the game. The deck also includes a variety of removal and disruption spells like Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment to control the board and protect your creatures. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and maintain a strong board presence to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of efficient removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. Tasigur, the Golden Fang serves as the commander, providing card advantage and a solid win condition. The deck includes a variety of spells that can disrupt the opponent's game plan, such as counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak, removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Damnation, and hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to generate incremental advantage. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's color requirements and includes key lands like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Wasteland.
